arm_group.description: To find out the the dose of sugammadex for recovery of the TOF ratio to 0.9 within 2 minutes from profound neuromuscular block : Dixon's up-and-down method
To find out the the dose of sugammadex for recovery of the TOF ratio to 0.9 within 2 minutes from profound neuromuscular block : Dixon's up-and-down method

brief_summary.textblock:
To find out the dose of sugammadex for recovery of the TOF ratio to 0.9 within 2 minutes
      from profound rocuronium-induced neuromuscular block in young and elderly adult patients.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Dose of Sugammadex for Rapid Reversal of Profound Neuromuscular Block in Young and Elderly Patients

detailed_description.textblock:
A previous study reported that elderly patients required a longer time to recover from
      rocuronium induced neuromuscular block compared to younger patients. Therefore, the aim of
      this study is to find out the dose of sugammadex for rapid recovery from profound
      neuromuscular block in young and elderly adult patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  20-40 years or ≥70 years ASA class I-II patients who received surgery less than 2
             hours.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  anticipated difficult intubation

          -  neuromuscular, hepatic or renal disorders

          -  drug allergy

          -  body mass index >30 kg/m2 or body mass index <18 kg/m2

          -  emergency surgery

facility.name: Department of Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine and Anesthesia and Pain Research Institute, Yonsei University College of Medicine

primary_outcome.measure: The dose of sugammadex for recovery of the TOF ratio to 0.9 within 2 minutes from profound neuromuscular block

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics/Dynamics Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Outcomes Assessor)
